subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Stupid but True
msgSnippet: I m having trouble getting Thoth to work on the Mac.  Especially being Unicode, I thought it would work with no problem. I just downloaded and installed it on
messageBody:
I'm having trouble getting Thoth to work on the Mac.  Especially being Unicode, I thought it would work with no problem.

I just downloaded and installed it on my PC at work and it seems fine, though.  Perhaps I did something wrong on the other platform?

It is interesting that I can view Moira's post and Anthony's second post, but his original post still appears as gibberish.  I'll have to wait until I get home and see if these most recent two work on my Mac.

Ron Cameron

Moira O'Brien <mj@...> wrote:
F TNk F andDstAnd nQ.  /JDOm font ddnt wDk bikoz HX znt a VnikOd vDSn.
 
A a matD v intDest, F Am tFpN Hs in /windOz mEl.  `en F trFd t tFp t in /gMgl mEl it did not wDk.
 
/mQra
  
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Anthony Grahn
To: Read_Alphabet@ yahoogroups. com
Sent: Monday, November 19, 2007 9:48 AM
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Stupid but True

Sorry for the mysterious characters; I thought I saw evidence that Yahoo groups allowed fancier html than I expected. The prior posting happened to work on some platforms because missing glyphs are searched for in any available font (eg ThothUni on windows). Mea culpa
Of course if you have ThothUni installed I think you'll be able to read the following on any platform:

 ¥E¥U¥J ¥D¥]¥K¥J¤õ

>

> computer, but it will not display properly here. Yet your mail is displaying
> below correctly in QS.  How did you manage to do this? I have both jerome,
> thoth and thoth unicode on my computer.
>
> Moira

I'm having trouble getting Thoth to work on the Mac.  Especially being Unicode, I thought it would work with no problem.

I just downloaded and installed it on my PC at work and it seems fine, though.  Perhaps I did something wrong on the other platform?

It is interesting that I can view Moira's post and Anthony's second post, but his original post still appears as gibberish.  I'll have to wait until I get home and see if these most recent two work on my Mac.

Ron Cameron
